books.title: Little Dorrit
books.author: Charles Dickens
books.summary: After returning home from a long period spent working in China, a man tries to assist a family forced to live in a debtor’s prison.

books.title: The Square Emerald
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: Scotland Yard’s first female investigator sets out to prove the innocence of a convicted forger.

books.title: The Diary
books.author: Samuel Pepys
books.summary: The diary of a man living in London in the 17th century.

books.title: Recollections of Full Years
books.author: Helen Herron Taft
books.summary: Helen Herron Taft, wife of William Howard Taft, the twenty-seventh President of the United States, recalls her life married to one of America’s most influential political figures.

books.title: The Road to Oz
books.author: L. Frank Baum
books.summary: A young girl takes a passerby down the road near her farm when they find themselves transported to another land.

books.title: Golf Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of Wodehouse’s golf stories featuring the Oldest Member.

books.title: Henry VI, Part III
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: Henry VI is overthrown and Edward Plantagenet becomes the new King of England.

books.title: The King of Elfland’s Daughter
books.author: Lord Dunsany
books.summary: The people of Erl want magic, and get their wish.

books.title: Tracks in the Snow
books.author: Godfrey R. Benson
books.summary: A rector investigates the mystery behind a strange letter that may be connected to his friend’s murder.

books.title: The Magician
books.author: W. Somerset Maugham
books.summary: A young engaged couple meet a mysterious man who claims to have practical knowledge of the occult.

books.title: Travel Essays
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A collection of Robert Louis Stevenson’s travel essays.

books.title: A Bid for Fortune
books.author: Guy Boothby
books.summary: A young Australian man struggles to reclaim his love from the clutches of an evil mastermind.

books.title: The Bolshevik Myth
books.author: Alexander Berkman
books.summary: A left-wing radical records his experiences in revolutionary Russia.

books.title: The Religion of Nature Delineated
books.author: William Wollaston
books.summary: Wollaston attempts to derive ethics and religion by using rational thought and observation of the natural world, without resorting to revelation or received religion.

books.title: Eugene Onegin
books.author: Alexander Pushkin
books.summary: A jaded Russian fop’s disdain for the world catches up with him.

books.title: Candide
books.author: Voltaire
books.summary: A witty satire that tells of the young Candide’s attempts to stay optimistic through a series of incredible hardships.

books.title: Looking Backward
books.author: Edward Bellamy
books.summary: A man falls asleep in 1887 and wakes up over a century later in a socialist utopia.

books.title: The Law of the Four Just Men
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: A group of wealthy vigilantes continue their quest to bring justice to those criminals beyond the reach of conventional law.

books.title: The Imitation of Christ
books.author: Thomas à Kempis
books.summary: Thomas à Kempis provides instructions for a Christian spiritual life.

books.title: Travel Essays
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A collection of Robert Louis Stevenson’s travel essays.
